instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin no chime
threads.message:
After replacing <RESISTOR>R7978</RESISTOR> and getitng the board into an S0 state with fan spin I get no image or chime seems likes its brain dead. Fans will spin fast but nothing happens no image on screen nothing on external either.

any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin no chime
threads.message: do u have all CPU Rails ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin no chime
threads.message: History? Why was the resistor replaced?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin no chime
threads.message:
Im not too sure on the history. the board wasnt powering on but getting to an s3 state. Replaced the resistor because it was giving a low value compared to known good and that got it to fan spin.

board has no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> rail.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin no chime
threads.message: Low value is because you are measuring in-circuit so there was never anything wrong. You can heat up the GPU and see if it lives again. If it still has an original GPU with date code 11/12 this board is a waste of time anyway as it is a ticking time bomb.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin no chime
threads.message: I cannot find the date on this thing. Heating it up changed nothing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin no chime
threads.message: Of course there is a date code on the GPU.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin no chime
threads.message:
date code is 11/13
i have no cpu vcore

not sure if this is normal but <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>,<CHIP>U5410</CHIP> and <CHIP>U5430</CHIP> are all outputting around 0.30-0.50v
also vcc of <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> is only getting 4.97v it should be 5v right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin no chime
threads.message:
Old GPU which is going to fail soon if it is not already dead. No Vcore also sucks in general. 
4.97 vs 5.00, do you really think that will matter? Do you really think your multimeter/probes etc. will be accurate enough to worry about 0.03V?

Could be bad BIOS/bad CPU/bad PCH/knocked off resistor/anything and next month a dead GPU. Save yourself the headache and forget about this one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin no chime
threads.message:
My multimeter is over by .3 so i usually get 5.3v on 5v lines so thats why i asked it would mean im probably arounf 4.94?

i shall forget i suppose.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fan spin no chime
threads.message: You can try another BIOS but after that it will be a time waster.
